intro: Centaurium rumelicum, commonly known as the lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has slender, branched stems. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Centaurium rumelicum is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
